page.title: 11BIRDLIFE IN CLIFTON-ON-TEME
page.content:
{Woodpeckers}are found around {Clifton. The{greater-spotted}has made himself quite a character in the village gardens,and the{green woodpecker}has recently started attacking the church spire. At the {Shelsley Walsh }hill climb there are a resident pair of{buzzards} which are a hazzard for the{pheasant} breeders in the area.Below the hillclimb there are a pair of{herons } by the{River Teme. } The banks of{Sapey Brook}are a wonderful habitat for many rare bird species.{Dippers}and{kingfishers}find the seclusion ideal and the surrounding vegetation provides a home for{long-tailed tits}and{goldcrests.
{by Nicholas Rowe (age 10)
